fields.Name: Name
fields.usersToMakeToFollow: Users to make to follow the record
fields.linkList: Link with Target Entity through relationships

tooltips.toEmailAddress:
Multiple email addresses can be specified by separating them with a semicolon.

Available placeholders:
* `{$$variable}`
tooltips.attachmentsVariable: A Formula variable name that contains an attachment ID or an array of attachment IDs. You can generate needed attachments in a Formula script in a previous action.
tooltips.createEntityFormula: Use Formula to set entity attributes with calculated values.
tooltips.entityType: An entity type the rule is applied to.
tooltips.targetReport: The scheduled workflow will run the actions for all records returned by the specified list report.
tooltips.type:
* After record created/updated – Whenever a record is created/updated. The action can be initiated by a user, another workflow, a formula script, or by the system.
* Manual – A user can start the workflow by clicking a button on the record detail view.
* Scheduled – Run automatically based on the defined scheduling.
* Sequential – Can be run by another workflow rule.
* Signal – When the specified signal is broadcast in the system.
tooltips.processOrder: Multiple workflow rules for the same target will be processed according their order. The lower the order value, the sooner a rule runs.
tooltips.manualConfirmation: To display a confirmation dialog before running the workflow.
tooltips.manualConfirmationText: A text to show to a user when confirming workflow start.
tooltips.schedulingApplyTimezone: Apply the system default timezone to scheduling. Otherwise, UTC will be used.
tooltips.manualDynamicLogic: Conditions making the workflow available for a record.
tooltips.manualTeams: Teams who will have access to run the workflow. If empty, only admin will have access.
tooltips.manualAccessRequired: Access to a record required to be able run the workflow.
tooltips.requestHeaders:
Additional headers.

Format:
```key: value```

Available placeholders:
* `{$attribute}`
* `{$$variable}`
* `{#secrets.name}`
tooltips.requestContentVariable: A variable name. If specified, payload will be taken from the variable.
tooltips.portalOnly: If checked, the workflow will be triggered only in portal.
tooltips.portal: The specific portal where the workflow will be triggered. Leave empty if you need it to run in any portal.
tooltips.scheduling:
Crontab notation. Defines the frequency of workflow rule runs.

`*/5 * * * *` – every 5 minutes

`0 */2 * * *` – every 2 hours

`30 1 * * *` – at 01:30 once a day

`0 0 1 * *` – on the first day of the month

emailAddressOptions.teamUsers: Users of teams related to target record

texts.atLeastOneMustBeMet: At least one must be met
texts.formulaInfo: Expression evaluating to true or false

messages.loopNotice: Be careful about a possible looping through two or more workflow rules continuously.
messages.messageTemplateHelpText:
Available placeholders:

* `{entity}` – target record
* `{user}` – current user
* `{$$variable}` – formula variable

serviceActionsHelp.generateAndSendPassword: A new password will be generated and sent to the user's email address.
serviceActionsHelp.optOut:
Optional parameter: targetListId. If not specified, then marks the user's email address opted-out.

 Example:
```{"targetListId": "TARGET_LIST_ID"}```
serviceActionsHelp.convertCurrency: Optional parameter: targetCurrency. If not specified, then it will convert to the default currency.
serviceActionsHelp.sendInEmail:
Parameters:
* templateId - ID of PDF template
* emailTemplateId - ID of email template
* to - recipient (optional parameter); by default will be sent to billing contact or account; example: `link:account.assignedUser`

Example:

```{
    "templateId": "TEMPLATE_ID",
    "emailTemplateId": "EMAIL_TEMPLATE_ID",
    "to": "link:billingContact"
}```
